_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FACILITY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY.
     THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOUTH CENTRAL FS, INC. ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF A ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, OR OTHER LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEE OR AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.
     THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY, WHICH IS LOCATED AT RT. 40,  IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT.  THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 30,000 GALLON STORAGE TANK, LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.   ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.   
THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 200,000 POUNDS, THIS INCLUDES THE AMOUNT OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT COULD BE STORED IN NURSE TANKS.

THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.
     THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AS ADOPTED BY STATE REGULATION AND TEH STANDATDS OF THE U.S OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES MAKE UP OUR ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTOY:
     THERE HAS NOT BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT:
     - HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATHS, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY;

NOR
     - TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE NOT RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTER IN 
        PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

THE EMERGENCY REPSPONSE PROGRAM.
     THE FACILITY HAS:
     - A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD, 29 CFR 1910.38;
     - PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-
       TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA);
     IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE BROWNSTOWN FIRE DEPARTMENT AND FAYETTE COUNTY ESDA AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.  OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLANS HAVE BEEN COORDINATED WITH BOTH THE FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THE ESDA.
PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.
     SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSEDD THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  IN (2000) WE PLAN TO DO EXTENSIVE MAINTENANCE AND UPGRADE THE FACILITY TO MEET NEW STATE REQULATIONS FOR THE HANDLING AND STORAGE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.                                                                                                                                                                           WORSE-CASE RELEASE QUANITITY WOULD NOT EXCEED 85% OF TANK CAPACITY.  THIS WILL BE MAINTAINED BY DAILY INVENTORY.
